doc.field: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
Originally called Belvoir--Fairy Fort--The Creek Farm--Hommes or Money (Boys) School

1 Story Frame, Paired Column Portico, 9/9, 6/6, 5 Course American Bond, Beaded Siding, Rose Head Nails, 1 1/4 Muntins, Wood Shingles, Dormer Storage, Bulkhead, Winter Kitchen with Oven, Split Rivens, 4 Panel Doors, Diagonally-set Chimney, Transom with Sidelights, 5 Bay, Mortise and Tenon Joinery, Pegged Joinery, Pitsaw Marks, Reciprocating Saw Marks, Blinds, Roman Numerals on Flooring, 2 Pile, Privy, late 19th century Bank Barn, Ghost
survey data: Virginia Road Traces--Work Projects Administration
Originally @ Keswick; Moved to Milton c 1790 by Francis Walker; Then relocated to Rt 647 near Cismont mid 19th century by Thomas Walker Lewis
